newsitem.title: FRANCE: ALPINE SKIING-TOMBA TO MISS ADELBODEN RACE.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-TOMBA TO MISS ADELBODEN RACE.

text.p: Italian Alberto Tomba, who went to bed with flu after the first leg of a men's World Cup slalom on Sunday, will miss the next race, a giant slalom on Tuesday in Adelboden, Switzerland, his manager said.
Giorgio Sgorlon said the world champion had been examined by the Italian team doctor who advised him not to take part in Tuesday's race.

The triple Olympic gold medallist hesitated to come to the the French Alps resort of Chamonix at all after a flare-up of pain in the wrist which he injured in a fall last October forced him to halt training in Italy on Wednesday.
Tomba clocked the second fastest time in the first leg of Sunday's slalom but did not start the second. The race was won by Austrian Thomas Sykora.

Tomba, who has had a difficult start to the season, hopes to be back for a slalom on Sunday in Wengen, Switzerland. His main goal this season are next month's world championships in Sestriere, Italy, in which he hopes to excel before his home fans.
